newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: U.N. says false document found in Croatia enclave.
newsitem.headline: U.N. says false document found in Croatia enclave.

text.p: A forged document seeking information about alleged war criminals is circulating in Eastern Slavonia, a largely Serb region of Croatia administered by the United Nations, the U.N. war crimes tribunal said on Friday.
The document, purportedly issued by the tribunal, sought information about 178 people said to be the subject of criminal proceedings at the Hague-based court.
"The prosecutor, Justice Louise Arbour, states emphatically that this document did not originate from her office or from anyone within the tribunal," the tribunal said in a statement.
The document was passed to the tribunal by the U.N. Transitional Administrator for Eastern Slavonia, who is supervising the region's reintegration into Croatia.
The tribunal said Arbour planned to trace the source of the document and take "appropriate steps" against the perpetrators of the fraud.
